alert.note: Alert for Door (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 14 at 3:39AM CST until December 15 at 9:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WILL BRING HEAVY SNOW, A WINTRY MIX, AND HAZARDOUS TRAVEL THROUGH THURSDAY... .A strong low pressure system will move across the Great Lakes, spreading a wintry mix of snow, freezing rain and sleet across the region today. The mixed precipitation will turn to all snow over much of northern Wisconsin this afternoon and evening, with periods of heavy snow expected tonight. East winds will also gust to 25 to 40 mph, which could combine with heavy snow accumulations to cause tree and power line damage. Sporadic power outages will be possible. Travel could become hazardous due to the snow and ice. Some uncertainty remains on exact precipitation type and amounts as temperatures will be near freezing. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations between 4 and 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Door County. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. People should consider delaying travel. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.
